verses.verse: Come down<WH3381>, and sit<WH3427> in the dust<WH6083>, O virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Babylon<WH894>, sit<WH3427> on the ground<WH776>: there is no throne<WH3678>, O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans<WH3778>: for you shall no more<WH3254> be called<WH7121> tender<WH7390> and delicate<WH6028>.

Take<WH3947> the millstones<WH7347>, and grind<WH2912> meal<WH7058>: uncover<WH1540> your locks<WH6777>, make bare<WH2834> the leg<WH7640>, uncover<WH1540> the thigh<WH7785>, pass over<WH5674> the rivers<WH5104>.
Your nakedness<WH6172> shall be uncovered<WH1540>, Yes<WH2781>, your shame shall be seen<WH7200>: I will take<WH3947> vengeance<WH5359>, and I will not meet<WH6293> you as a man<WH120>.
As for our redeemer<WH1350>, the Lord<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name<WH8034>, the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel<WH3478>.

Sit<WH3427> you silent<WH1748>, and get<WH935> you into darkness<WH2822>, O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans<WH3778>: for you shall no more<WH3254> be called<WH7121>, The lady<WH1404> of kingdoms<WH4467>.

I was angry<WH7107> with my people<WH5971>, I have polluted<WH2490> my inheritance<WH5159>, and given<WH5414> them into your hand<WH3027>: you did show<WH7760> them no mercy<WH7356>; upon the ancient<WH2205> have you very<WH3966> heavily<WH3513> laid your yoke<WH5923>.
And you said<WH559>, I shall be a lady<WH1404> for ever<WH5769>: so that you did not lay<WH7760> these things to your heart<WH3820>, neither did remember<WH2142> the latter end of it<WH319>.

Therefore hear<WH8085> now this<WH5719>, you that are given to pleasures, that dwell<WH3427> carelessly<WH983>, that say<WH559> in your heart<WH3824>, I am<WH657>, and none else beside me<WH3427>; I shall not sit as a widow<WH490>, neither shall I know<WH3045> the loss of sons<WH7908>:

But these two<WH8147> things shall come<WH935> to you in a moment<WH7281> in one<WH259> day<WH3117>, the loss of sons<WH7908>, and widowhood<WH489>: they shall come<WH935> upon you in their perfection<WH8537> for the multitude<WH7230> of your sorceries<WH3785>, and for the great<WH3966> abundance<WH6109> of your enchantments<WH2267>.

For you have trusted<WH982> in your wickedness<WH7451>: you have said<WH559>, None sees<WH7200> me<WH2451>. Your wisdom and your knowledge<WH1847>, it has perverted<WH7725> you<WH559>; and you have said in your heart<WH3820>, I am<WH657>, and none else beside me.

Therefore shall evil<WH7451> come<WH935> upon you<WH3045>; you shall not know from from where it rises<WH7837>: and mischief<WH1943> shall fall<WH5307> upon you<WH3201>; you shall not be able to put it off<WH3722>: and desolation<WH7722> shall come<WH935> upon you suddenly<WH6597>, which you shall not know<WH3045>.

Stand<WH5975> now with your enchantments<WH2267>, and with the multitude<WH7230> of your sorceries<WH3785>, where<WH834> you have labored<WH3021> from your youth<WH5271>; if so be you shall be able<WH3201> to profit<WH3276>, if so be you may prevail<WH6206>.

You are wearied<WH3811> in the multitude<WH7230> of your counsels<WH6098>. Let now the astrologers<WH1895>, the stargazers<WH2374>, the monthly<WH2320> prognosticators<WH3045>, stand up<WH5975>, and save<WH3467> you from these things that shall come upon you<WH935>.

Behold<WH7179>, they shall be as stubble; the fire<WH784> shall burn<WH8313> them<WH5337>; they shall not deliver themselves<WH5315> from the power<WH3027> of the flame<WH3852>: there shall not be a coal<WH1513> to warm<WH2552> at<WH217>, nor fire to sit before it<WH3427>.

Thus shall they be unto you with whom you have labored<WH3021>, even your merchants<WH5503>, from your youth<WH5271>: they shall wander<WH8582> every one<WH376> to his quarter<WH5676>; none shall save you<WH3467>.
